title: The 4 Best Books on Martin Luther

media:group.media:title: The 4 Best Books on Martin Luther
media:group.media:description:
Martin Luther was the man who started the Protestant Reformation. From a monastery in Wittenberg, Luther first posted the 95 Theses that challenged the Roman Catholic teaching and practice of indulgence selling. But who was Martin Luther? Why did Luther start the Reformation? With so many books on Martin Luther, I give you the 4 best books on Luther I have read so far. 

Still haven’t subscribed to the channel? ►► https://goo.gl/KNKDPg

Ryan M. Reeves (PhD Cambridge) is Associate Professor of Historical Theology at Gordon-Conwell Theological Seminary.  Twitter: https://twitter.com/RyanMReeves       Instagram: https://instagram.com/ryreeves4/

Recommended Biographies of Luther:
D. MacCulloch, 'The Reformation': http://amzn.to/2o9zARz 
Lyndal Roper, 'Martin Luther': http://amzn.to/2o9spss
Bainton, 'Here I Stand': http://amzn.to/2dvA0up
Kittleson, 'Luther the Reformer': http://amzn.to/2emujwz
Oberman, 'Luther Between God and Devil': http://amzn.to/2eK5VsP
Hendrix, 'Luther: Visionary Reformer': http://amzn.to/2eTSTpS 

Another biography not featured here but recommended is:
Stephen Nichols: 'Martin Luther: a guided tour': http://amzn.to/2dvAWPv
